name: Relationship Aggression Therapeutic Relief x64
description:
Made a separate project as to not break my Winter #UE4Jam submission.

A first person shooter where you pickup and throw household items at each other. Some items count as aggressive items and will increase your hate, other items count as friendly items and will increase your love. Keep going until one of the players builds up too much hate or love from the other and see your results.

This is a 2 player game where:

Player 1: Uses a keyboard and Mouse:

  • WASD to move
  • Space to Jump
  • Move Mouse to Look
  • Left Mouse to Pickup/Throw items

Player 2: Uses a Controller:

  • Left Stick to Move
  • Right Stick to Look
  • Bottom Face (A) to Jump
  • Right Face (B) to Pickup/Throw items

You can also rename and change sexes of each of the players characters

Other peoples content used in the Submission:

Plate Crash 1 by edwar64896 at (https://freesound.org/people/edwar64896/sounds/381259/) Plate Crash 2 by mikaelfernstrom at (https://freesound.org/people/mikaelfernstrom/sounds/68728/) Pillow Hit 1 by simon.rue at (https://freesound.org/people/simon.rue/sounds/49966/) Pillow Hit 2 by Planman at (https://freesound.org/people/Planman/sounds/208111/) Rustling 1 by THE_bizniss at (https://freesound.org/people/THE_bizniss/sounds/37900/) Rustling 2 by j1987 at (https://freesound.org/people/j1987/sounds/106114/) Metal Knife 1 by akennedybrewer at (https://freesound.org/people/akennedybrewer/sounds/389185/) Metal Knife 2 by smokenweewALT at (https://freesound.org/people/smokenweewALT/sounds/412389/) Cardboard Box 1 by VSokorelos at (https://freesound.org/people/VSokorelos/sounds/346169/) Cardboard Box 2 by newagesoup  at (https://freesound.org/people/newagesoup/sounds/364740/)

Characters base model and cloting made with MakeHuman. (http://www.makehumancommunity.org/)

RATR Version 0.6:

  • Repackaged for 64bit
  • Sound recording now works. The sound recording plugin for UE4 is only packaged for 64bit and will not deploy on a 32bit exe.
  • Unfortunately converting to 64bit makes the program just over 100mb.
